entry.title: Not1More and AFSC member Hilda Martinez was captured by border...
entry.content:
Abolish ICE Denver

Not1More and AFSC member Hilda Martinez was captured by border patrol, leaving her children with their aunt and without a parent (their father was deported previously). Hilda will see a judge tomorrow in New Mexico.

Hilda and her children came to some of the car rallies Abolish ICE Denver held this year and is a beloved member of the immigrant rights community!

entry.title: "Hilda Martinez Murillo has four children, between the ages...
entry.content:
Abolish ICE Denver

"Hilda Martinez Murillo has four children, between the ages of 5 and 14. She‚Äôs the sole provider and breadwinner since her husband, Ivan, was deported last year. Hilda is a community leader with the American Friends Service Committee in Colorado.

This past week, Hilda was in the El Paso area to visit family. On January 27, 2021 HIlda was traveling with other people in a vehicle and they were stopped at a Border Patrol checkpoint. She was arrested and is now charged with "smu...ggling Ixxxxxl aliens‚Äù. She is detained at he Dona Ana County Detention Center in New Mexico awaiting hearings this week. Funds will support her legal fees and her children.

Hilda is a quiet person in her daily life, but outspoken and fearless in the face of injustice. When her husband was detained by ICE and then held for 8 months at the GEO facility in Aurora, CO Hilda worked tirelessly to advocate for his release . The family helped to expose the lack of access to medical care and mishandling of contagious diseases in detention. At the beginning of the pandemic, she led #FreeThemAll calls to action at both detention centers and jails.

Even after her husband‚Äôs deportation, and despite the challenges of being a single mother, she remained committed to fighting for the human rights of all. She has testified in favor of bills at the state capitol and met with many Colorado congresspeople to advocate for just and humane immigration reform and the elimination of immigration detention centers. Most recently she advocated for the new congress to finally tackle an overhaul of our immigration policies, participating in two public direct actions in January alone.

Hilda‚Äôs own immigration case has been slowly winding through the system as she complies with everything asked of her. She applied for asylum as she is very afraid to return to Mexico due to persecution there and is currently in the US on humanitarian parole. Hilda was also the victim of a home invasion and attempted homicide here in the US while awaiting asylum. She has a UVISA application pending from this incident."

See More*Sigue en espa√±ol* Hilda Martinez Murillo has four children, between the age‚Ä¶ Jennifer Piper needs your support for Bring Hilda home - Financial solidarity

entry.title: Grab your popcorn and snacks, and join us for a virtual showing...
entry.content:
Abolish ICE Denver

Grab your popcorn and snacks, and join us for a virtual showing of The Undocumented Lawyer followed by a panel discussion with Lizbeth Mateo and Ingrid Encalada Latorre as they debrief the documentary and share their stories.

The Boulder County Sanctuary Coalition and Ingrid Encalada Latorre are organizing this showing as a fundraiser for the advocate/organizer position who works to support Ingrid, her family, and the Coalition. The Coalition has been awarded a matching gran...t of $7,500 from the Fund for Unitarian Universalist Social Responsibility to help support our efforts providing sanctuary to Ingrid and promoting her campaign No Mas Chuecos. We have already raised $2,500 and we need your help fundraising another $5,000. We are asking for a donation of $25 per person to attend the showing. Although, we will not turn anyone away.

A matching grant means every donation is doubled until we reach our goal so if you join us for the showing and donate $25, it automatically becomes $50! :)

If you are unable to attend the showing on Sun., Feb. 28th at 4 p.m., you can still participate. We will have access to the documentary and the panel discussion recording until Sat., March 6th so feel free to donate, and we will send everything out to you by email on Mon., March 1st.

If you have any questions, please feel free to contact us at teamingrid1@gmail.com

---------------------------------

Tome sus palomitas y su snack, y √∫nase con nosotros para una exhibici√≥n virtual de The Undocumented Lawyer, seguida de un panel de discusi√≥n con Lizbeth Mateo e Ingrid Encalada Latorre donde van a comentar del documental y comparten sus historias.

La Coalici√≥n del Santuario del Condado de Boulder e Ingrid Encalada Latorre est√°n organizando esta exhibici√≥n para recaudar fondos para el puesto de la organizadora que trabaja para apoyar a Ingrid, su familia y la Coalici√≥n. La Coalici√≥n ha recibido una beca de contrapartida de $7,500 del Fondo para la Responsabilidad Social Unitaria Universalista para ayudar con nuestros esfuerzos para apoyar a Ingrid y promover su campa√±a No Mas Chuecos. Ya hemos recaudado $2,500 y necesitamos su ayuda para recaudar otros $5,000. Solicitamos una donaci√≥n de $25 por persona para asistir a la exhibici√≥n. Aunque, no rechazamos a nadie.

Una beca de contrapartida significa que cada donaci√≥n se duplica hasta que logramos nuestra meta, por lo que si se une para la exhibici√≥n y dona $25, ¬°autom√°ticamente se convierte en $50! :)

Si usted no puede asistir en vivo el domingo 28 de febrero a las 4 p.m., a√∫n puede participar. Tendremos acceso al documental y la grabaci√≥n del panel de discusi√≥n hasta el s√°bado 6 de marzo, as√≠ que si√©ntase libre de donar, y le enviaremos todo por correo electr√≥nico el lunes 1 de marzo.

Si tiene alguna pregunta, no dude en contactarnos en teamingrid1@gmail.com

entry.title: Tania is selling enchiladas on February 6th with the Solidarity...
entry.content:
Abolish ICE Denver

Tania is selling enchiladas on February 6th with the Solidarity Meals program. She arrived to the U.S. when she was just five years old, and through DACA she‚Äôs been able to pursue higher education, work for Denver Public Schools as a family liaison, and have a family of her own. She‚Äôs now applying for her residency, which is an incredibly expensive process, so she‚Äôs selling enchiladas this weekend to help raise money to cover the costs. You can order at https://solidaritymeals.paperform.co. Pickup will be in Denver this weekend, and money can be sent via Venmo to @/tania-baez-30. Place in Denver for pick up 1400 N Lafayette St Denver Co 80218 ready 1 pm https://solidaritymeals.paperform.co/‚Ä¶

entry.title: *Sigue en espa√±ol* ACTION ALERT - We share with you in anger...
entry.content:
Abolish ICE Denver

*Sigue en espa√±ol*
ACTION ALERT - We share with you in anger and sadness the unjust news that Not1More member Hilda Martinez was arrested at a Border Patrol checkpoint on Friday and is being held in jail in New Mexico right now. Hilda Martinez requests your immediate solidarity. She was visiting family in El Paso last week. These checkpoints are a part of the daily terror and oppression Border Patrol inflicts on the region. She will have her first hearing this week. Her child...ren are safe here in Colorado as they did not accompany her on this visit.
Action steps:
1. Leave a love note or prayer here for Hilda. We'll be sharing them with her when she calls.
2. Attend our livestream vigil tonight. https://fb.me/e/42WwzHSmJ Next steps will be shared and we'll hear from her or her sister.
3. Contribute to this gofundme and share in solidarity to support her legal costs and her children. gf.me/u/zhqkph
4. Sign and share her petition https://www.change.org/p/united-state-attorney-free-hilda-b‚Ä¶
#FreeHilda #KeepFamiliesTogether
*********************************************
ALERTA de ACCION ‚Äì Compartimos con rabia, tristeza y firmeza que una l√≠der de Ni1Mas, Hilda Martinez, fue arrestada el viernes por parte de la Patrulla Fronteriza en un punto de reten y esta encarcelada en Nueva M√©xico en este momento. Hilda se solicita su solidaridad inmediata. . Ella estuvo visitando con familia en el √°rea de El Paso, TX la semana pasada. Estos retenes son parte del terror y represi√≥n que se impone la Patrulla Fronteriza en las comunidades fronterizas. Tendr√° su primera audiencia esta semana. Sus hijos est√°n aqu√≠ al salvo en Colorado como no fueron con ella de paseo.
Paso de acci√≥n:
1. Deja una oraci√≥n o nota de amor por Hilda Aqu√≠. Vamos a estar compartiendo estos con ella.

entry.title: "After her daughter's birth, Angela and her family...
entry.content:
Abolish ICE Denver

"After her daughter's birth, Angela and her family were not allowed to stay in the U.S. Instead, they were expelled to Mexico without a court hearing under a pandemic-related measure authorized by the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) last spring, according to lawyers.

Thousands of asylum-seekers waiting at America's doorstep face similar predicaments as a result of a network of policies the Trump administration implemented to deter would-be migrants, whom it a...ccused of gaming the country's humanitarian programs to gain easy entry into the U.S.

President Biden decried these measures as "inhumane" and vowed to end them during the campaign, accusing the Trump administration of forcing asylum applicants to live "in squalor." After winning the election, his advisers said unwinding the many policies would take time, largely due to the pandemic.

During Mr. Biden's first day in office, his administration stopped placing asylum-seekers in the so-called "Remain-in Mexico" program. He is also set to formally end the policy and other asylum limits this week as part of an executive order to retool how U.S. border officials will process migrants going forward.
But the new administration continues to use the Trump-era CDC order to quickly expel migrants ‚Äî including families with children ‚Äî without allowing them to request U.S. refuge, according to court documents and interviews with attorneys. The government has also not said whether it will allow the estimated 20,000 migrants in Mexico with pending asylum applications to continue their cases inside the U.S."

See MoreU.S. border agents continue to expel migrants, including families with children, without court hearings under a policy instituted by the Trump administration.

cbsnews.com

Biden retains Trump's border rules for now, with migrants stuck in Mexico or facing expulsion

U.S. border agents continue to expel migrants, including families with children, without court hearings under a policy instituted by the Trump administration.U.S. border agents continue to expel migrants, including families with children, without court hearings under a policy instituted by the Trump administration.

entry.title: Sigue en espanol AFSC will be hosting another vigil in February...
entry.content:
Abolish ICE Denver

Sigue en espanol

AFSC will be hosting another vigil in February with the theme- Love Knows No Borders, No Walls

For the 12th year in a row, AFSC will deliver handmade valentines to detention center detainees and day laborers. People who could use extra love right now. We consider this a meditation. Make something beautiful for someone separated from loved ones, separated by borders and distance or by walls. We assert that our Love knows No Borders, No Walls.

...

Don‚Äôt miss the Virtual Vigil on Monday, February 1st, 6:00-7:00 pm right here or on our page.
*********************
AFSC llevar√° a cabo otra vigilia en febrero con el tema: El amor no conoce fronteras, sin muros.

Por 12 a√±os consecutivo, AFSC entregar√° tarjetas de San Valent√≠n hechas a mano a los detenidos y jornaleros del centro de detenci√≥n. Personas que podr√≠an usar amor extra ahora mismo. Consideramos esto como una meditaci√≥n. Haga algo hermoso para alguien separado de sus seres queridos, separado por los bordes y la distancia o por las paredes. Afirmamos que nuestro amor no conoce fronteras, ni muros.

No se pierda la Vigilia Virtual el lunes 1 de febrero, de 6:00 a 7:00 p.m. Se presenta aqui en Facebook.

Todos los d√≠as, los trabajadores indocumentados y sus familias enfrentan no solo la amenaza constante de ICE y la violencia policial, sino tambi√©n condiciones de trabajo cada vez m√°s inseguras y de explotaci√≥n, vivienda insegura, exclusi√≥n de los servicios b√°sicos de salud y acceso casi imposible a los beneficios de lo que restos del estado de bienestar. ¬°√önase a nosotros para discutir estas realidades y luchas de costa a costa!

entry.title: This New Year‚Äôs Eve, please join the @denvercommunists and other activists across the Colorado Front Range who have...
entry.content:
This New Year’s Eve, please join the @denvercommunists and other activists across the Colorado Front Range who have organized a noise demonstration in solidarity with our incarcerated neighbors and political prisoners like anarchist, activist, and poet, Eric King.

What better way is there to show solidarity other than showing up, making some noise & closing out this shit show of a year together? Show up with your best NYE noise makers, demonstration banners and signs. Who knows, we may even try out a new flavor of Pig face? Fed or Jeffco anyone?

We are planning on meeting up at Harriman Lake Park at 7:30 pm at W Quincy Ave & S. Kipling Pkwy, then heading to the facility which is across the street at 9595 W Quincy Ave Littleton, CO 80123.

**Neither we, nor the other organizers of this action, are affiliated in any way with Eric King nor the Eric King Support team @SupportEricKing. We all just want to show some love and and we are happy to signal boost that!**

“I have been incredibly fortunate to have so many people come into my life and take a stand with me so that I didn’t have to face this shit alone… From the smallest greeting to the big gestures, everything has meant so much to me… Now that said, I stand by my actions... After seeing what happened in Ferguson, so close down the road, I was disgusted by the lack of mobilization in my city. Three hours away people were fighting for their lives and we weren’t even taking to the streets. We were doing nothing. My act as a very personal display of my anger and rage toward the state as well as an act of solidarity to everyone in Ferguson. We never know our own strength until we are tested and even with my ridiculous sentence I feel at least proud to have been able to stand strong and refuse to cooperate with the state. I am just really happy that I don’t have to take this alone and have so many amazing people standing next to me. Until all are free.”
— Eric King

https://unicornriot.ninja/2016/eric-king-given-10-yr-sentence-throwing-molotovs-empty-govt-building/

entry.title: Join us Friday, December 18 at 7 p.m. for a premiere virtual screening of ‚ÄúThe Facility.‚Äù ...
entry.content:
Join us Friday, December 18 at 7 p.m. for a premiere virtual screening of “The Facility.”

“The Facility” is a short documentary film chronicling the lived experiences of immigrants being held at the GEO detention facility in Aurora, Colorado. This film addresses the personal loss and consequences caused by for-profit detention and the federal government's broken immigration policies. Legal and medical experts highlight horrific abuses including death, medical neglect, nutrition issues, and prolonged detention during the coronavirus pandemic. To tell their stories, current and former detainees, families fighting to be reunited, and advocates come together to share their experiences behind the walls of the GEO immigration detention facility in Aurora.

@acluofcolorado @coloradopeoplesalliance @co_immigrant @keshagrijalva @_floodlight_

Following the screening will be a Q&A session with the director, legal experts, and individuals featured in the film with first-hand experience of the systemic abuse occurring inside the facility.

Panelists include:

Jeremy Flood, “The Facility” Director
Raul Medina Perez, COPA, Community Organizer who was formerly detained at GEO
Kesha Davalos Grijalva, Immigrant rights advocate whose husband is detained at GEO
Keinada Andereas, Colorado Student who was formerly detained at GEO
Hans Meyer, The Meyer Law Office, Lead Attorney
Denise Maes, ACLU of Colorado, Public Policy Director

Please RSVP for the screening in advance for this free event: https://aclu.zoom.us/webinar/register/WN_nUbTy8-VQpif8nMzqtUzQw

Trailer: https://youtu.be/cGOCejy48Jo

“The Facility” is presented by ACLU of Colorado, Colorado Immigrant Rights Coalition, and Colorado Hispanic Bar Association.
